Smells like it. RENTON

Too young for what? Renton looks in each direction along the empty passageway

Iggy Pop is not dead. He toured last year. Tommy went to DIANE

She was right. I had to find something new. There was onl thing for it.

as he is wanted by the police in connection with an armed in a jeweller's in Corstorphine. Take care. Yours with lo Diane. There is a buzz at the door. Renton re-examines the lette buzz. RENTON

Too right it is. Now look, have you got anything to eat, fucking Lee Marvin, by the way.
Begbie is sitting on the bed in his underwear, eating cer television. A small carry-out is nearby. Renton finishes He pauses at the open door, looking back towards his gues RENTON (v.o)
Begbie settled in in no time at all. Begbie opens a can of beer. Renton closes the door.
Renton closes his door. He is about to walk away when he shouting. BEGBIE (from the bedsit)
Rents, Rents, come fucking back here. Renton opens the door. Begbie is holding out an empty pac Look. RENTON
What? BEGBIE
I've no fucking cigarettes. Begbie throws the packet down to the floor. It lands near turned back to the television and takes a swig of beer. RENTON
Right. Renton closes the door again.
Renton and Begbie lie in the single bed with their heads Begbie snores. Renton is wide awake, with a pair of smell inches from his nose. RENTON (v.o)
Yeah, the guy's a psycho, but it's true, he's a mate as w what can you do?

Where the first empty packet of cigarettes fell to the fl large heap of empty packets: the product of weeks at sixt one lands on the pile. Hey, I'm wanting a bet put on. RENTON

I'm a fugitive from the law. I can't be seen on the fucki streets. Now watch my lips. Kempton Park. Two-thirty. Fiv to win. Bad Boy.

Begbie, alone in the bedsit, is screaming a cry of primal RENTON (v.o)
Bad Bot came in at 16 to 1. And with the winnings, we wen celebrate.

To loud music and strobing, fractured lights, surrounded dances near a tall woman. Other people dance nearby. Begb up to Renton, who sits on a stool at one side drinking fr beer. Begbie and the Woman walk away. Renton looks around various men and women. RENTON (v.o)

Diane was right. The world is changing, music is changin, are changing, even men and women are changing. One thousa from now there'll be no guys and no girls, just wankers. great to me. It's just a pity that no one told Begbie.

Renton's gaze continues to wander around. RENTON (v.o)
You see, if you ask me, we're heterosexual by default, no decision. It's just a question of who you fancy.
Begbie and the Woman continue their embrace as she unbutt RENTON (v.o)

It's all about aesthetics and it's fuck all to do with mo Suddenly Bedbie freezes. He is holding the 'Woman's' groi something there that shouldn't be. Begbie goes crazy, sim to put his clothes back on, hit the Woman and get out of

Now, listen to me, you little piece of junky shit. A joke fucking joke, but you mention that again and I'll cut you Understand? Begbie produces his knife. There is a knock on the door. There is another knock.

Since I last saw him, Sick Boy had reinvented himself as and a pusher and was here to mix business and pleasure, s 'contacts', as he constantly informed me, for the great s that was one day going to make him rich.

Good chips. RENTON

Well, Christ, if I'd known you were going to get so humpt it, I wouldn't have bothered. Are you going to eat that? He takes Renton's fish supper and adds it to his own. Have you got a passport? RENTON

Well, this guy I've met runs a hotel. Brother. Loads of c Does a nice little sideline in punting British passports foreigners. Get you a good price. RENTON

As you can see, it's a beautiful conversion. Two bedrooms kitchen/diner. Fully fitted. Lots of storage. All mod con hundred and twenty quid a week. From nowhere, Begbie and Sick Boy spring out at him.

God home from hospital and died about three weeks l Been dead for ages before the neighbours complained about smell and the police broke the door down. Tommy was lying down in a pool of vomit. If everyone keeps their mouth shut, there'll be no one go jail.

We settled on sixteen thousand pounds. He had a lot more suitcase, but it was better than nothing. And just for a felt really great, like we were all in it together, like like it meant something. A moment like that, it can touch inside, but it doesn't last long, not like sixteen thousa pounds.

Buy yourself that island in the sun? BEGBIE
For four fucking grand? One plam tree, a couple of rocks, sewage outflow. SPUD

For fuck's sake. MAN

All down my fucking front, you fucking idiot. MAN

Sorry's no going to dry me off, you cunt. RENTON
Cool down, Franco. The guy's sorry. BEGBIE
Not sorry enough for being a fat cunt. MAN

Jesus Christ. SICK BOY

I've got to get to the hospital, man. BEGBIE

(to Spud) You're not going to and fucking hospital. (to Sick Boy) You're staying there. (to Renton) And you bring me a fucking cigarette. Renton swivels and stands up. And the bag. B Renton selects a cigarette and hands it over to Begbie. B deeply and then blows the smoke towards Renton

Renton gets up and goes to the small ba light on above the mirror and looks at himself. He washes drinks a glass of water, then walks back to the bedroom. jacket and shoes. He stands over Begbie, then reaches car Begbie's arm up. As he does so he realizes that Spud is w say nothing. Renton takes the bag. Begbie stirs but does

Now, I've justified this to myself in all sorts of ways: a big deal, just a minor betrayal, or we'd outgrown each you know, that sort of thing, but let's face it, I ripped off. My so-called mayes. But Begbie, I couldn't give a sh him, and Sick Boy, well, he'd have done the same to me if he'd thought of it first, and Spud, well, OK, I felt sorr Spud -- he never hurt anybody.

So why did I do it? I could offer a million answers, all The truth is that I'm a bad person, but that's going to c I'm going to change. This is the last of this sort of thi cleaning up and I'm moving on, going straight and choosin I'm looking forward to it already. I'm going to be just l the job, the family, the fucking big television, the wash machine, the car, the compact disc and electrical tin ope health, low cholesterol, dental insurance, mortgage, star leisurewear, luggage, three-piece suite, DIY, game shows, food, children, walks in the park, nine to five, good at washing the car, choice of sweaters, family Christmas, in pension, tax exemption, clearing the gutters, getting by, ahead, to the day you die.
